data.title: JSONFile GetRoot fixes #1383
data.body: Fixes for JSONFile->GetRoot() returning a JSONValue&. I started out fixing the original #1383 issue, but though, if this mistake was made once, how many more times as it made? And here is your answer. It's too bad cppcheck couldn't find it.

data.title: Fix linux high cpu usage #940
data.body: @EternalXY had it right (thanks), it is the ALSA SDL implementation that is coded poorly. SDL had half the solution in a comment! (now it is in their latest 2.0.6?) and the other half they are now aware of apparently. It took a while of trudging thru the SDL repo to see the intent behind these changes, and for the last change, SDL does not know, so it must be because @EternalXY is so smart. It is gated specifically for Linux, because SDL is a cross platform library, and other platforms have support for ALSA sound drivers, which may not incur these issues.

data.title: A minor typo causing assertion fail when saving a project file
Add a check for null native event (in the case of a script event)
[C#] Improve defining managed events

data.title: [C#] Set executable project to be startup by default in generated solutions

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
Generated solutions in VS don't set the executable project to be the default, instead it sets one of the referenced ones.  It is necessary to manually change to the executable, otherwise when running the project you can a "can't start a dll" error.

This should be pretty easy to fix and I think, though am not sure, Visual Studio for Mac and MonoDevelop do the "right thing" here and set the exe as default, though this needs testing to be sure

data.title: [Import] Better FBX importing

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
This is a big topic, we're currently using [assimp](http://www.assimp.org/), which is good at some formats (mostly DAE), though is "not great" with FBX (there are a number of reasons for this, much to do with funky node offsets and stuff in FBX that aren't really mappable very well to internal assimp data structures)

I am thinking we need to hook up the Autodesk FBX SDK and I think we can, it does introduce some licensing challenges potentially that need to be looked into... 

FBX files can contain multiple meshes and we should be very flexible on import, most likely using the prefab system for maximum runtime representation of FBX (and Blender/DAE) assets.

data.title: [Editor] Tick box disappears when multiple objects with different boolean values are selected

data.title: [Editor] Prevent automatic scroll bar movement when selecting nodes in hierarchy frame

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
>Hierarchy window, when we shift-select the scroll bar moves back to the top instead of staying at the same spot. However if we already selected more than one entity before using the shift the scroll bar does not move. It should never move.

This is also an issue when navigating between components in the inspector frame, the scroll bar can unexpectedly jump.

data.title: [Graphics] Postprocess Component

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
> Post process, we should be able to put post process on camera, in a volume and in the game mode / level. (I am not sure how the post process should behave when hover lap, does they have priority or do they add up)
	-  for a camera we should add components for the post process
	-  for a volume we should be able to create a post process effect volume (similar to the zone). When a player is inside that volume the post process are apply
	- for a level we should be able to set post process so wherever the player is the effect are on (it will be like having a volume that feel up the all level)

data.title: [Editor] Improve the color theme to provide better visual information

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
> More color coded, the editor does not give enough visual information in general. 
	-  The editor is grey and thing that are highlighted are also grey, we should use different color .
	-  When they are highlighted with the blue, only the outline is blue. The icon or text should be highlighted but still readable.
	-  When we select an object in the Project window the Inspector changes but the object does not get highlighted in the Project window, however the last object selected in the Hierarchy is highlighted, it should stay highlighted but should have a different highlighted color to indicate that we are not currently working on that object in the Inspector, this will help the level designer know on what he was working in the current scene. 
	-  The font, button feels too big in general and there is too much space between each line. (Personal preference but we have less information overhaul and have to scroll more, for instance the default Node component text a third of my screen when it could take half that space. The arrow are removed since we can use the shortcut snapping)

data.title: [Editor] - Crash when dragging FBX directly from file system into scene editor

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
Dragging an FBX from the file system, directly into a 3D scene editor without first importing it by dragging into the resource container, crashes with this stack (likely same crash in Windows).  

Note that this isn't possible to reproduce on Linux and and SDL drag and drop needs position data for the drop event added.

```
Thread 0 Crashed:: CrBrowserMain  Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread
0   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010175a745 AtomicEditor::SceneView3D::HandleDragEnded(Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) + 341
1   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x000000010175c7e2 Atomic::EventHandlerImpl<AtomicEditor::SceneView3D>::Invoke(Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) + 50
2   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x00000001019f2eb1 Atomic::Object::OnEvent(Atomic::Object*, Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) + 129
3   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x00000001019f3723 Atomic::Object::SendEvent(Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) + 707
4   com.thunderbeastgames.atomiceditor	0x0000000101c8a8c7 Atomic::UIDragDrop::DragEnd() + 455
```
